Returns: The total number of items in this adapter.
getItemCount().Description: Returns the total number of items in the data set held by the adapter.

Returns: A new ViewHolder that holds a View of the given view type.
Parameters: ViewGroup: The ViewGroup into which the new View will be added after it is bound to an adapter position.
int: The view type of the new View.
onCreateViewHolder(android.view.ViewGrou.Description: Called when RecyclerView needs a new @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#ViewHolder_E@ of the given type to represent an item. This new ViewHolder should be constructed with a new View that can represent the items of the given type. You can either create a new View manually or inflate it from an XML layout file. The new ViewHolder will be used to display items of the adapter using @B_android#support#v7#widget#RecyclerView#Adapter#onBindViewHolder_E@. Since it will be re-used to display different items in the data set, it is a good idea to cache references to sub views of the View to avoid unnecessary @B_android#view#View#findViewById_E@ calls.
